questions.question: Which of the following statements does not make sense?

responses.text: Intrinsic interoperability is important because it helps increase the quantity of integration projects that may be required to accommodate new businessrequirements, thereby fostering agility.
Intrinsic interoperability is important because it enables services to exchange data without having to resort to transformation technologies.
Intrinsic interoperability is important because it is fundamental to enabling services to be repeatedly composed.
Intrinsic interoperability is important because one of the goals of service-oriented computing is to increase intrinsic interoperability.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true.?

responses.text: To apply service-orientation requires the use of Web services.
Web services are required in order to build service-oriented solutions.
When discussing SOA and service-oriented computing, the term 'Web service' must always be synonymous with (have the same meaning as) the term'service'.
None of these statements are true.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?

responses.text: 'Contract first' design is important to SOA because it makes you think about service contract design options at the same time that you are building theunderlying service logic.
'Contract first' design is important to SOA because it forces you to establish standardized service contracts prior to the development of the underlying servicelogic.

'Contract first' design is important to SOA because without a contract, services cannot be invoke, However, there is no preference as to when, during theservice delivery lifecycle, the contract should be designed or established.
'Contract first' design is an unproven design technique that is not commonly employed when delivering service-oriented solutions and is therefore notconsidered important to SOA.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false?

responses.text: A service is a unit of logic to which service-orientation has been applied to a meaningful extent.
Services are designed to increase the need for integration.
Services are the fundamental building blocks of service-oriented solutions.
A service composition is comprised of services.

questions.question: Which of the following statements accurately describes the strategic benefit of Increased Federation?

responses.text: A target state whereby all services are always consistently delivered as Web services.
A target state in which the entire enterprise has been successfully service-oriented.
A target state whereby the enterprise has adopted SOA by replacing all legacy environments with custom-developed services.
A target state whereby standardized service contracts have been established to express a consistent and unified service endpoint layer.

questions.question: In order to achieve __________ we have traditionally required __________ projects. With service-orientation, we aim to establish an intrinsic level of __________ within each service so as to reduce the need for __________ effort.

responses.text: vendor diversity, integration, vendor diversity, design
agility, development, scalability, development
interoperability, integration, interoperability, integration
autonomy, integration, statelessness, integration

questions.question: Below are four statements about business and technology alignment, as it pertains to service-oriented computing. Which of these statements is false?

responses.text: Business and technology alignment represents the extent to which an IT enterprise and its automated systems can mirror and evolve in alignment with thebusiness.
Service-oriented computing promotes the abstraction and accurate encapsulation and expression of business logic in services. This supports business andtechnology alignment.
The pursuit of business and technology alignment can be supported by the collaboration of business analysts and technology experts during analysis andmodeling phases.

In order for an IT enterprise to increase business and technology alignment, its business analysts must become more technical and assume the responsibilitiesof technology experts so that they can independently design quality business services that take both business and technology considerations into account.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a benefit of maintaining a vendor-neutral and business-driven context for a service-oriented architecture?

responses.text: Establish a technology architecture with a fixed scope and purpose that remains unchanged, regardless of how the business may need to change over time.
Avoid establishing a technology architecture that will need to be replaced in the near future when it no longer adequately fulfills business requirements.
Leverage new technological innovation in order to maximize the fulfillment of business requirements.
Establish a technology architecture that can stay in alignment with how the business may need to change over time.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false?

responses.text: The design standardization of service contracts helps increase interoperability between services.
Design standardization can introduce organizational and cultural challenges because it requires that the design standards be regularly enforced.
The design standardization of service contracts helps avoid the need for transformation technologies.
Design standardization is not relevant to the design of service compositions. It is only relevant to the design of individual services.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false?

responses.text: The governance burden of services is not impacted by the SOA project delivery approach.
The bottom-up approach to SOA project delivery results in less up-front impact, but will usually increase the eventual governance burden of services.
Alternative approaches exist that provide a compromise between bottom-up and top-down SOA project delivery approaches.
Up-front analysis as part of a top-down SOA project delivery approach helps reduce the eventual governance burden of services.

questions.question: What is wrong with this statement: 'We delivered two services last year.Even though each service was delivered by a separate project team in a different locationand at a different time, I am confident that the services will be reasonably interoperable because each project team was asked to use the same design standards.'

responses.text: The statement is incorrect because services should never be delivered by different project teams.
The statement is incorrect because services rely on post - implementation integration effort in order to achieve interoperability, not design standards.
The statement is incorrect because SOA delivery projects require that services be created at exactly the same time in order to guarantee interoperability.
There is nothing wrong with this statement.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false ?

responses.text: Industry standards are usually produced by standards organizations.
Industry standards are usually created by standards committees so that they do not favor any one vendor or organization.
The use of industry standards alone automatically results in fully standardized service - oriented solutions.
XML is an example of an industry standard.

questions.question: You can create __________ or __________ service inventories.

responses.text: process - specific, process - wide
domain, enterprise
domain, process - specific
enterprise, process - specific

questions.question: __________ and __________ are used to classify and organize services within a service inventory.

responses.text: service compositions, service - oriented solutions
service capabilities, service compositions
service models, service layers
service contracts, service capabilities

questions.question: The standardization of services within a service inventory supports the repeated __________ of services, thereby increasing their potential reuse.

responses.text: integration
composition
definition
expression

questions.question: Solution logic is classified as 'service-oriented' after :

responses.text: it has been built using Web services
it has been built using RPC technologies
it has been performance tested to a meaningful extent
service - orientation has been applied to a meaningful extent

questions.question: A __________ can be part of a / an __________ which can be assembled from __________ within a / an __________.

responses.text: component, object, enterprises, service
service inventory, service, enterprises, service composition
service, service composition, services, service inventory
service inventory, service, service compositions, enterprise

questions.question: Two common, yet opposing SOA delivery approaches are:

responses.text: bottom - up and upside - down
top - down and left - to - right
upside - down and left - to - right
none of the above

questions.question: When designing service - oriented architectures, it is important to take the strategic goal of Increased Vendor Diversity Options into account, because this goal:

responses.text: encourages you to commit to one vendor platform and stick with that platform, which fosters long - term flexibility
encourages you to retain the constant option of using proprietary vendor features and extensions so that they can be entrenched into your service - orientedarchitectures for long - term flexibility
encourages you to retain the constant option to extend or replace parts of your service - oriented architectures with different vendor technologies or products, which fosters long - term flexibility
encourages you to bridge disparity between vendor platforms by using modern transformation technologies for long - term flexibility

questions.question: Services can be referred to as __________ because of the enterprise - centric design considerations of service - orientation and SOA.

responses.text: enterprise architectures
enterprise resources
enterprise definitions
enterprise - centric business models

questions.question: A service inventory is considered to have normalized services when:

responses.text: its scope does not overlap with any existing databases
service boundaries within the service inventory do not overlap with each other
each service within the service inventory is not used by more than one service composition
legacy systems within the service inventory boundary do not overlap with each other

questions.question: Service metadata can be centrally registered within a __________ for discoverability purposes.

responses.text: service inventory
service composition
service registry
service model

questions.question: When planning a transition toward SOA, we are usually required to balance the __________ goals with the __________ requirements.

responses.text: strategic(long - term), tactical(short - term)
strategic(long - term), unimportant(low priority)
tactical(short - term), unimportant(low priority)
unimportant(low priority), important(high priority)

questions.question: Services are ideally designed to be:

responses.text: agnostic and reusable
unidirectional and semi - granular
linear and logistically decomposable
returnable and non - standardized

questions.question: The ROI( return on investment) potential of services is increased by:

responses.text: increasing the amount of agnostic services within an inventory
increasing the amount of non - agnostic services within an inventory
increasing the amount of legacy systems within an enterprise
decreasing the scope of a service inventory

questions.question: Which of the following is not the result of achieving the strategic goal of Reduced IT Burden ?

responses.text: a reduction in waste and redundancy among automation solutions(compared to a traditional silo - based IT enterprise)
a reduction in the quantity of services(compared to a traditional silo - based IT enterprise)
a reduction in the overhead associated with IT governance and evolution(compared to a traditional silo - based IT enterprise)
a reduction in size and operational cost of IT as a whole(compared to a traditional silo - based IT enterprise)

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true ?

responses.text: Organizational agility can be viewed as the ability of IT to rapidly produce new legacy applications on - demand.
Organizational agility can be viewed as a state whereby the organization increases its responsiveness with the support of a more agile IT enterprise.
Organizational agility can be viewed as a tactical benefit that empowers the organization to respond to new business requirements by building new applicationsfrom scratch each time.
Organizational agility can be viewed as the ability of IT project managers to rapidly replace slow performing programmers without jeopardizing project deliveryschedules.

questions.question: To qualify as a service composition, at least __________ participating services need to be present.Otherwise, the service interaction only represents a point - topoint exchange.

responses.text: two
four
six
eight

questions.question: There are two basic types of service - oriented solution logic : __________ and __________

responses.text: services, service registries
services, service compositions
service candidates, service registries
top - down service models, bottom - up service models

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false ?

responses.text: Service - orientation is a design paradigm that must be applied on an enterprise - wide basis in order to be successful.
Service - orientation is a design paradigm comprised of aset of design principles.
Service - orientation is an evolutionary design paradigm that has been influenced by older, established IT paradigms and platforms.
Service - orientation is applied to logic in order to create service - oriented logic.

questions.question: When an organization cannot implement a single enterprise service inventory, it has the option to organize collections of services into multiple service inventoriesreferred to as __________.

responses.text: domain service inventories
sub - inventories
sectional service inventories
service inventory subsets

questions.question: A part of a service contract that is commonly standardized is the __________.

responses.text: data model
service agent
service registry
data agent

questions.question: Service - oriented computing advocates a concept based on the creation of a service layer with standardized and unified endpoints(service contracts) while allowingindividual service implementations to remain disparate and independently governe, This concept is known as :

responses.text: interoperability
transformation
federation
isolation

questions.question: Service - oriented computing aims to increase an organization 's responsiveness by allowing it to adapt to change more efficiently and effectively. This is known as:

responses.text: organizational diversity
organizational agility
organizational federation
organizational interoperability

questions.question: One of the fundamental characteristics of service-oriented architecture is:

responses.text: business-driven
integration-centric
inventory-neutral
silo-driven

questions.question: By applying a __________ strategic scope to the technology architecture, it can be kept in constant synch with how the business evolves over time.

responses.text: consistently decreasing
middleware-centric
vendor-driven
None of the above answers correctly complete this sentence.

questions.question: Why is it recommended to establish a service-oriented architectural model that is vendor-neutral?

responses.text: Because a vendor-neutral architectural model provides you with the opportunity to fully leverage and form dependencies on proprietary (vendor-specific) vendorfeatures.

Because a vendor-neutral architectural model provides you with the opportunity to build service-oriented solutions only with open source technologies, therebyavoiding the use of vendor technologies altogether.
Because a vendor-neutral architectural model provides you with the freedom to diversify its implementation by leveraging multiple vendor technologies asrequired.
A vendor-neutral service-oriented architectural model is not recommended.

questions.question: Service Autonomy, Service Statelessness, and Service Loose Coupling are examples of:

responses.text: service-oriented architecture types
service-orientation design principles
service models
none of the above

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?

responses.text: Service-orientation is a revolutionary design paradigm comprised solely of new design techniques and practices never before used in IT' s history.
The only known historical influence of the service - orientation design paradigm is procedural programming.
The service - orientation design paradigm has been influenced by several established design paradigms and platforms.
None of the above statements are true.

questions.question: When enterprise - wide standardization is unattainable, multiple domain service inventories may need to be created instead of :

responses.text: multiple enterprise service inventories
a single enterprise service inventory
multiple enterprise service registries
a single enterprise service registry

questions.question: The use of __________ services tends to __________ the size of service compositions.

responses.text: autonomous, increase
stateless, decrease
scalable, decrease
agnostic, increase

questions.question: The distinct ownership and governance requirements introduced by agnostic services can introduce the need for more __________ staff and less __________staff.

responses.text: management - centric, administration - centric
development - centric, quality assurance - centric
enterprise - centric, project - centric
development - centric, communication - centric

questions.question: XML and XML Schema are examples of:

responses.text: custom design standards commonly used by service - oriented solutions
custom design characteristics commonly found in service - oriented solutions
industry standards commonly used by service - oriented solutions
industry characteristics commonly found in service - oriented solutions

questions.question: A product or technology that is key to facilitating service discovery and service governance in general is a:

responses.text: visual service development tool
business analysis tool
service registry
none of the above

questions.question: Administering, maintaining, and evolving the services and service inventories that you build and own can be broadly referred to as:

responses.text: federated SOA ownership
SOA standardization
SOA governance
SOA enforcement

questions.question: A primary focus of service modeling is the encapsulation and abstraction of business logic in support of defining business service candidates.What is wrong withthis statement ?

responses.text: Service modeling is a phase dedicated to defining non - business service logic only.
There is no such thing as a business service when creating service - oriented solutions.
The service modeling process results in the implementation of services, not the definition of service candidates.
There is nothing wrong with this statement.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true ?

responses.text: Integration is the effort required to enable interoperability.A goal of service - oriented computing is to increase intrinsic integration, thereby reducing the need forinteroperability.
Interoperability is the effort required to enable integration.A goal of service - oriented computing is to increase intrinsic integration, thereby reducing the need forinteroperability.
Integration is the effort required to enable interoperability.A goal of service - oriented computing is to increase intrinsic interoperability, thereby reducing the needfor integration.
Interoperability is the effort required to enable integration.A goal of service - oriented computing is to increase intrinsic interoperability, thereby reducing the needfor integration.

questions.question: Project Team Alpha delivers Service A for Solution1.Project Team Beta delivers Service B for Solution2.Some time later, Project Team Omega wants to reuse Service A and Service B for its new Solution3.How would Services A and B need to have been designed in order for Project Team Omega to successfully reuse these services without having to resort to amajor integration project ?

responses.text: Services always require the use of transformation technologies in order to communicate.Therefore, major integration effort is unavoidable in this scenario.
Services A and B need to reside on the same physical server or workstation, thereby allowing them to be reused without the need for major integration effort.
Services A and B need to be standardized and designed with an emphasis on intrinsic interoperability so that they are compatible regardless of when or bywhich project team they are delivered.
Service A needs to be designed using a different vendor platform than Service, This enables vendor diversity, thereby guaranteeing interoperability.

questions.question: A fundamental means of achieving business and technology alignment in support of service - oriented computing is :

responses.text: through the use of a service registry because this allows business and technology - centric services to be located in the same place
through the creation of business services because this enables services to encapsulate and express business logic
through the use of a business registry because this allows for the centralized registration of business analysts
through the creation of a vendor - specific architecture because this supports both the vendor - neutral and business - driven SOA characteristics

questions.question: Service composition is important to the success of SOA initiatives because :

responses.text: You can only create service - oriented solutions as service compositions.
Services that compose multiple legacy systems can be designed to leverage only the parts of each system that are relevant to the functional context of theservice.
Service compositions enable the service - oriented computing goal of Increased Federation by guaranteeing that service endpoints are consistently designed anddeveloped.
Services that can be composed and recomposed support several service - oriented computing goals, including Increased ROI and Increased OrganizationalAgility.

questions.question: A software program that invokes and interacts with a service is referred to as a :

responses.text: service contract
service inventory
service container
none of the above

questions.question: The ability of one service to __________ another service forms the basis of service __________.

responses.text: divert, diversification
register, registries
consume, composition
integrate, integration

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true ?

responses.text: For a service consumer to interact with a service it must comply to the requirements of the service contract.
The service contract is used to express meta data about a service for human consumption only, and compliance to the service contract by service consumers istherefore not required.
Service contracts are only used to access a service when the service consumer itself is not a service.
All of these statements are true.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false ?

responses.text: The standardization of service contracts supports the strategic goal of Increased Intrinsic Interoperability.
The standardization of service contracts supports the strategic goal of Increased Governance Integration.
The standardization of service contracts is supported by service - orientation.
The standardization of service contracts supports the strategic goal of Increased Federation.

questions.question: If a service can have one or more service capabilities, then how can a service consumer interact with a service ?

responses.text: It can 't. The service must only provide one service capability in order for it to be accessible by service consumers.

Each service capability represents a function that the service has to offer. The service consumer can invoke and interact with one service capability at a time,thereby only using a subset of the service' s overall functionality.

Service capabilities are designed to be composed together, which means that in order for a service consumer to interact with a service, it must be designed toinvoke all of its service capabilities at the same time.
Services do not have service capabilities that are explicitly invoke, Services almost always exist as event - driven programs that transparently intercept serviceconsumer messages at runtime.

questions.question: An IT enterprise proceeds with an SOA initiative that is based on the creation of a single enterprise service inventory.However, conflicts arise when different ITdepartments disagree on who will own the services and how they will be governe, Which of the following alternative approaches could be chosen to address theseconflicts ?

responses.text: The top - down approach is chosen.This allows services to be modeled subsequent to their design, thereby enabling each service to be governed by multipleowners.

It is decided to proceed with the creation of multiple domain service inventories.This allows collections of services to be independently governed by differentowners, while still enabling the IT enterprise as a whole to transition toward SOA.
The established 'contract last' approach is chosen, allowing different IT managers to focus on contract-related governance issues after the services aredeployed and in use.
Because SOA projects absolutely require enterprise-wide standardization and further demand the creation of an enterprise service inventory, the IT managershave no choice than to cancel the project.

questions.question: Project Team A delivers Domain Service Inventory A with 20 services. If Project Team B delivers Domain Service Inventory B with 50 services, how many servicesare in the Enterprise Service Inventory?

responses.text: An enterprise service inventory is not comprised of domain service inventories.

questions.question: What is the minimum number of domain service inventories you need in order to create a single enterprise service inventory?

responses.text: two
three
one for each business domain
An enterprise service inventory is not comprised of domain service inventories.

questions.question: Four IT managers from different organizations have chosen to adopt SOA When subsequently interviewed, each was asked to explain why this decision wasmade. One of the IT managers is confused and chose to adopt SOA for the wrong reasons. Study the following responses and select the one that is not accurate:

responses.text: SOA will help us increase the responsiveness of the organization as a whole.When our business encounters change, our IT department will be able to adaptand respond to this change more efficiently and effectively than before.
SOA will help us increase the amount of value weget from the software programs we build as reusable services.Over time, this will allow us to improve thecost - effectiveness of IT as a whole.

SOA will help us streamline our IT enterprise.Our goal, ultimately, is to turn the IT department into a part of the organization that provides increased value tothe business while reducing its overall burden.

SOA will help our IT department overcome cultural challenges we 've traditionally had with the ownership of EAI (Enterprise Application Integration) platforms.Through the use of proven bridging and transformation technologies introduced by SOA, any IT staff that have historically disagreed with each other aboutownership issues, will now be able to overcome their differences.

questions.question: Below are excerpts from four different SOA adoption strategy documents. Based on your understanding of SOA, service-orientation, and the goals of service- oriented computing, select the adoption strategy that is clearly the most likely to succeed:

responses.text: As part of our planned transition toward service-orientation, we will continue to extend the existing legacy applications with transformation-centric middlewarethat will enable seamless integration and runtime conversion between the different data models and data formats used by these applications.

Each of our existing legacy applications already establishes a domain boundary that is defined by the purpose of the application. We are confident that byleveraging these pre-defined silo-based boundaries we can create a series of effective domain service inventories, each with a scope that corresponds to alegacy application boundary.

Our strategy fully supports the tactical (short-term) nature of service-oriented computing by de-emphasizing standardization and allowing different projectteams to deliver services optimized to their respective requirements. This not only speeds the initial delivery of services, it further supports interoperability byenabling services to leverage established integration technologies.

Our strategy is to make the consistent application of service-orientation principles a priority in order to support the attainment of the goals of service-orientedcomputing. The primary justification for this approach is the fact that we have identified the goals of service-oriented computing to be in alignment with our ownbusiness goals.

questions.question: Which of the following is an expected result of successfully adopting SOA?

responses.text: A natural increase in runtime performance that you will gain as a result of the fact that service compositions will often be comprised of a greater amount ofindividually participating programs (services) than traditional distributed applications.

The fact that the existing IT organizational structure will not have to change because of how well a service-oriented enterprise fits into traditional ITdepartmental structures that are focused on project-centric application delivery.
The tactical (short-term) focus of service-orientation, which allows for the initial rapid delivery of services without concerns about their subsequent governance.

The strategic (long-term) target state that is attainable when many of the services delivered are interoperable and reusable, thereby allowing for them to berepeatedly composed in response to new and changing business requirements.

questions.question: Service Composition A is comprised of 4 services. Service Composition B is comprised of 6 services. Because both service compositions are comprised ofservices from the same service inventory, the service inventory will have a total of how many services?

responses.text: Based on the information provided, it' s impossible to know how many services reside in the service inventory because we don 't know how many other servicecompositions exist.

Based on the information provided, it' s impossible to know how many services reside in the service inventory because the quantity of services within a serviceinventory is not determined by the quantity of services in service compositions.

questions.question: I built a service - oriented solution a year ago comprised of 3 services.I 've just been told that the business process automated by the solution is going to be replacedby a new business process that introduces some changes to how the business process logic needs to be automate, What should I do?

responses.text: Replace the solution with a brand new service-oriented solution comprised of new services designed specifically to automate the new business process.
Identify the services within the solution that are no longer relevant to the new business process and permanently retire them so that no other service-orientedsolution inadvertently uses them.

Assuming there is an established service inventory in place, attempt to locate any existing services that can provide the logic required to automate the newbusiness process and then change how the services within the solution need to be composed, as required.

Due to the fact that service-oriented solutions are inherently unable to adapt to business process change, you should investigate for how long you can continueto use your current solution. Even if it does not exactly provide the functionality required by the new business process, it is still likely to automate a subset of thenew business process logic, thereby providing you with an opportunity to continue to get some value from the solution before you are forced to retire it.

questions.question: Which of the following statements makes sense?

responses.text: I am going to register my new service in the service registry so that other project teams can discover it in order to determine whether they should reuse it as partof service-oriented solutions they are planning to build.

I am going to register my new service inventory in the service registry in order to improve the performance of my service-oriented solution, because otherservices in my service composition will be able to dynamically discover and retrieve the new service much faster than if it was not registered in the serviceregistry.
I am going to register my new service in the service registry because Service Registration is one of the eight principles of service-orientation.
None of these statements make sense.

questions.question: Which of the following is a recommended or common part of a service-oriented enterprise?

responses.text: business services
service registries
service contracts
all of the above

questions.question: I anticipate building larger service compositions comprised of more services. How will this likely affect performance and infrastructure?

responses.text: It will likely increase performance demands and require an increase in infrastructure investment.
It will likely reduce performance demands and require an increase in infrastructure investment.
It will likely increase performance demands and require a reduction in infrastructure investment.
It will not affect performance or infrastructure.

questions.question: When following the distinct lifecycle phases of an SOA delivery project you are:

responses.text: discouraged from involving business analysts as part of the definition of services so that services remain technically focused
discouraged from involving technology experts as part of the definition of services so that services remain business focused
encouraged to have business analysts and technology experts collaborate in the definition of services so that services have and retain an alignment oftechnology and business
none of the above

questions.question: When you establish a federated service layer, you end up creating:

responses.text: a unified set of service contracts for the benefit of those building service consumers
a unified set of service consumer programs for the benefit of those building services to be consumed by those programs
a unified set of service compositions for the benefit of those responsible for defining service inventory boundaries
all of the above

questions.question: A service-oriented solution can be comprised of a single service with a single service capability.

responses.text: True
False

questions.question: Service-oriented analysis and service-oriented design are typical phases of an SOA delivery lifecycle.

responses.text: True
False

questions.question: The Universal SOA Commission (USOAC) has been standardizing the service-oriented architectural model since 1998. Their role is to regulate the marketplace toensure that all usages of the 'SOA' acronym for branding purposes are legitimate. They enforce this via product assessment and certification, a process that all ofthe major software vendors follow to obtain official USOAC certification.

responses.text: True
False

questions.question: Service-orientation supports the realization of the strategic goals associated with service-oriented computing.

responses.text: True
False

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false?

responses.text: Industry standards are usually produced by standards organizations.
Industry standards are usually created by standards committees so that they do not favor any one vendor or organization.
The use of industry standards alone automatically results in fully standardized service-oriented solutions.
XML is an example of an industry standard.

questions.question: You can create __________ or __________ service inventories.

responses.text: process-specific, process-wide
domain, enterprise
domain, process-specific
enterprise, process-specific

questions.question: __________ and __________ are used to classify and organize services within a service inventory.

responses.text: service compositions, service-oriented solutions
service capabilities, service compositions
service models, service layers
service contracts, service capabilities

questions.question: The standardization of services within a service inventory supports the repeated __________ of services, thereby increasing their potential reuse.

responses.text: integration
composition
definition
expression

questions.question: Solution logic is classified as 'service-oriented' after:

responses.text: it has been built using Web services
it has been built using RPC technologies
it has been performance tested to a meaningful extent
service-orientation has been applied to a meaningful extent

questions.question: A __________ can be part of a/an __________ which can be assembled from __________ within a/an __________.

responses.text: component, object, enterprises, service
service inventory, service, enterprises, service composition
service, service composition, services, service inventory
service inventory, service, service compositions, enterprise

questions.question: Two common, yet opposing SOA delivery approaches are:

responses.text: bottom-up and upside-down
top-down and left-to-right
upside-down and left-to-right
none of the above

questions.question: When designing service-oriented architectures, it is important to take the strategic goal of Increased Vendor Diversity Options into account, because this goal:

responses.text: encourages you to commit to one vendor platform and stick with that platform, which fosters long-term flexibility
encourages you to retain the constant option of using proprietary vendor features and extensions so that they can be entrenched into your service-orientedarchitectures for long-term flexibility
encourages you to retain the constant option to extend or replace parts of your service-oriented architectures with different vendor technologies or products,which fosters long-term flexibility
encourages you to bridge disparity between vendor platforms by using modern transformation technologies for long-term flexibility

questions.question: Services can be referred to as __________ because of the enterprise-centric design considerations of service-orientation and SOA.

responses.text: enterprise architectures
enterprise resources
enterprise definitions
enterprise-centric business models

questions.question: A service inventory is considered to have normalized services when:

responses.text: its scope does not overlap with any existing databases
service boundaries within the service inventory do not overlap with each other
each service within the service inventory is not used by more than one service composition
legacy systems within the service inventory boundary do not overlap with each other

questions.question: Service metadata can be centrally registered within a __________ for discoverability purposes.

responses.text: service inventory
service composition
service registry
service model

questions.question: When planning a transition toward SOA, we are usually required to balance the __________ goals with the __________ requirements.

responses.text: strategic (long-term), tactical (short-term)
strategic (long-term), unimportant (low priority)
tactical (short-term), unimportant (low priority)
unimportant (low priority), important (high priority)

questions.question: Services are ideally designed to be:

responses.text: agnostic and reusable
unidirectional and semi-granular
linear and logistically decomposable
returnable and non-standardized

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false?

responses.text: Service-orientation is a design paradigm that must be applied on an enterprise-wide basis in order to be successful.
Service-orientation is a design paradigm comprised of a set of design principles.
Service-orientation is an evolutionary design paradigm that has been influenced by older, established IT paradigms and platforms.
Service-orientation is applied to logic in order to create service-oriented logic.

responses.text: domain service inventories
sub-inventories
sectional service inventories
service inventory subsets

questions.question: A part of a service contract that is commonly standardized is the __________.

responses.text: data model
service agent
service registry
data agent

responses.text: interoperability
transformation
federation
isolation

questions.question: Service-oriented computing aims to increase an organization' s responsiveness by allowing it to adapt to change more efficiently and effectively.This is known as: https: //www.gratisexam.com/

responses.text: organizational diversity
organizational agility
organizational federation
organizational interoperability

questions.question: One of the fundamental characteristics of service-oriented architecture is:

responses.text: business-driven
integration-centric
inventory-neutral
silo-driven

questions.question: By applying a __________ strategic scope to the technology architecture, it can be kept in constant synch with how the business evolves over time.

responses.text: consistently decreasing
middleware-centric
vendor-driven
None of the above answers correctly complete this sentence.

questions.question: Why is it recommended to establish a service-oriented architectural model that is vendor-neutral?

responses.text: Because a vendor-neutral architectural model provides you with the opportunity to fully leverage and form dependencies on proprietary (vendor-specific) vendorfeatures.

Because a vendor-neutral architectural model provides you with the opportunity to build service-oriented solutions only with open source technologies, therebyavoiding the use of vendor technologies altogether.
Because a vendor-neutral architectural model provides you with the freedom to diversify its implementation by leveraging multiple vendor technologies asrequired.
A vendor-neutral service-oriented architectural model is not recommended.

questions.question: Service Autonomy, Service Statelessness, and Service Loose Coupling are examples of:

responses.text: service-oriented architecture types
service-orientation design principles
service models
none of the above

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?

responses.text: Service-orientation is a revolutionary design paradigm comprised solely of new design techniques and practices never before used in IT's history.
The only known historical influence of the service-orientation design paradigm is procedural programming.
The service-orientation design paradigm has been influenced by several established design paradigms and platforms.
None of the above statements are true.

questions.question: When enterprise-wide standardization is unattainable, multiple domain service inventories may need to be created instead of:

responses.text: multiple enterprise service inventories
a single enterprise service inventory
multiple enterprise service registries
a single enterprise service registry

questions.question: The use of __________ services tends to __________ the size of service compositions.

responses.text: autonomous, increase
stateless, decrease
scalable, decrease
agnostic, increase

questions.question: The distinct ownership and governance requirements introduced by agnostic services can introduce the need for more __________ staff and less __________staff.

responses.text: management-centric, administration-centric
development-centric, quality assurance-centric
enterprise-centric, project-centric
development-centric, communication-centric

questions.question: XML and XML Schema are examples of:

responses.text: custom design standards commonly used by service-oriented solutions
custom design characteristics commonly found in service-oriented solutions
industry standards commonly used by service-oriented solutions
industry characteristics commonly found in service-oriented solutions

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?

responses.text: Integration is the effort required to enable interoperability. A goal of service-oriented computing is to increase intrinsic integration, thereby reducing the need forinteroperability.
Interoperability is the effort required to enable integration. A goal of service-oriented computing is to increase intrinsic integration, thereby reducing the need forinteroperability.
Integration is the effort required to enable interoperability. A goal of service-oriented computing is to increase intrinsic interoperability, thereby reducing the needfor integration.
Interoperability is the effort required to enable integration. A goal of service-oriented computing is to increase intrinsic interoperability, thereby reducing the needfor integration.

questions.question: Project Team Alpha delivers Service A for Solution 1. Project Team Beta delivers Service B for Solution 2. Some time later, Project Team Omega wants to reuseService A and Service B for its new Solution 3. How would Services A and B need to have been designed in order for Project Team Omega to successfully reusethese services without having to resort to a major integration project?

responses.text: Services always require the use of transformation technologies in order to communicate. Therefore, major integration effort is unavoidable in this scenario.
Services A and B need to reside on the same physical server or workstation, thereby allowing them to be reused without the need for major integration effort.
Services A and B need to be standardized and designed with an emphasis on intrinsic interoperability so that they are compatible regardless of when or bywhich project team they are delivered.
Service A needs to be designed using a different vendor platform than Service, This enables vendor diversity, thereby guaranteeing interoperability.

questions.question: A fundamental means of achieving business and technology alignment in support of service-oriented computing is:

responses.text: through the use of a service registry because this allows business and technology-centric services to be located in the same place
through the creation of business services because this enables services to encapsulate and express business logic
through the use of a business registry because this allows for the centralized registration of business analysts
through the creation of a vendor-specific architecture because this supports both the vendor-neutral and business-driven SOA characteristics

questions.question: Complete the following statement with the correct sentence :'The objective of organizational agility is to dramatically reduce the time and effort required to fulfillnew or changed business requirements...'

responses.text: as long as the business requirements doesn’t change too often.
once legacy integration has been broadly achieved.
once a collection of mature agnostic services is available.
as long as the organization can continually outsource its IT projects.

questions.question: Service composition is important to the success of SOA initiatives because:

responses.text: You can only create service-oriented solutions as service compositions.
Services that compose multiple legacy systems can be designed to leverage only the parts of each system that are relevant to the functional context of theservice.
Service compositions enable the service-oriented computing goal of Increased Federation by guaranteeing that service endpoints are consistently designed anddeveloped.
Services that can be composed and recomposed support several service-oriented computing goals, including Increased ROI and Increased OrganizationalAgility.

questions.question: A software program that invokes and interacts with a service is referred to as a:

responses.text: service contract
service inventory
service container
none of the above

questions.question: The ability of one service to __________ another service forms the basis of service __________.

responses.text: divert, diversification
register, registries
consume, composition
integrate, integration

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?

responses.text: For a service consumer to interact with a service it must comply to the requirements of the service contract.
The service contract is used to express meta data about a service for human consumption only, and compliance to the service contract by service consumers istherefore not required.
Service contracts are only used to access a service when the service consumer itself is not a service.
All of these statements are true.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false?

responses.text: The standardization of service contracts supports the strategic goal of Increased Intrinsic Interoperability.
The standardization of service contracts supports the strategic goal of Increased Governance Integration.
The standardization of service contracts is supported by service-orientation.
The standardization of service contracts supports the strategic goal of Increased Federation.

questions.question: If a service can have one or more service capabilities, then how can a service consumer interact with a service?

responses.text: It can't. The service must only provide one service capability in order for it to be accessible by service consumers.

Each service capability represents a function that the service has to offer. The service consumer can invoke and interact with one service capability at a time,thereby only using a subset of the service's overall functionality.

Service capabilities are designed to be composed together, which means that in order for a service consumer to interact with a service, it must be designed toinvoke all of its service capabilities at the same time.
Services do not have service capabilities that are explicitly invoke, Services almost always exist as event-driven programs that transparently intercept serviceconsumer messages at runtime.

questions.question: An IT enterprise proceeds with an SOA initiative that is based on the creation of a single enterprise service inventory. However, conflicts arise when different ITdepartments disagree on who will own the services and how they will be governe, Which of the following alternative approaches could be chosen to address theseconflicts?

responses.text: The top-down approach is chosen. This allows services to be modeled subsequent to their design, thereby enabling each service to be governed by multipleowners.

It is decided to proceed with the creation of multiple domain service inventories. This allows collections of services to be independently governed by differentowners, while still enabling the IT enterprise as a whole to transition toward SOA.
The established 'contract last' approach is chosen, allowing different IT managers to focus on contract-related governance issues after the services aredeployed and in use.
Because SOA projects absolutely require enterprise-wide standardization and further demand the creation of an enterprise service inventory, the IT managershave no choice than to cancel the project.

questions.question: Project Team A delivers Domain Service Inventory A with 20 services. If Project Team B delivers Domain Service Inventory B with 50 services, how many servicesare in the Enterprise Service Inventory?

responses.text: An enterprise service inventory is not comprised of domain service inventories.

questions.question: What is the minimum number of domain service inventories you need in order to create a single enterprise service inventory?

responses.text: two
three
one for each business domain
An enterprise service inventory is not comprised of domain service inventories.

questions.question: Four IT managers from different organizations have chosen to adopt SOA,  When subsequently interviewed, each was asked to explain why this decision wasmade. One of the IT managers is confused and chose to adopt SOA for the wrong reasons. Study the following responses and select the one that is not accurate:

responses.text: SOA will help us increase the responsiveness of the organization as a whole. When our business encounters change, our IT department will be able to adaptand respond to this change more efficiently and effectively than before.
SOA will help us increase the amount of value we get from the software programs we build as reusable services. Over time, this will allow us to improve thecost-effectiveness of IT as a whole.

SOA will help us streamline our IT enterprise. Our goal, ultimately, is to turn the IT department into a part of the organization that provides increased value tothe business while reducing its overall burden.

SOA will help our IT department overcome cultural challenges we've traditionally had with the ownership of EAI (Enterprise Application Integration) platforms.Through the use of proven bridging and transformation technologies introduced by SOA, any IT staff that have historically disagreed with each other aboutownership issues, will now be able to overcome their differences.

questions.question: There can be different types or scopes of service-oriented architecture. For example, you could define separate architecture specifications for a service and aservice inventory.

responses.text: True
False

questions.question: Service modeling results in the definition of service candidates prior to the actual design and development of services. Select the correct answer.

responses.text: True
False

questions.question: A Service Level Agreement (SLA) is a common machine-readable document that is considered part of the technical service contract. Select the correct answer.

responses.text: True
False

questions.question: Service-oriented computing advocates establishing a technology architecture with increased vendor technology diversity, which means that service-orientedsolutions need to be consistently built using different vendor technologies and products. This way, the failure of any one vendor technology or product will not bringdown all services within a service inventory. Select the correct answer.

responses.text: True
False

questions.question: A common security consideration with service-oriented solutions is the need to apply security at the transport layer as opposed to the message layer. Select thecorrect answer.

responses.text: True
False

questions.question: Non-agnostic solution logic is logic that is considered single-purpose because it is unique to a specific task, and therefore not useful to other tasks. Select thecorrect answer.

responses.text: True
False

questions.question: Service-oriented computing aims to reduce the burden of IT upon the organization as a whole by reducing waste, operational cost, and overhead associated withthe governance and evolution of the IT enterprise. Select the correct answer

responses.text: True
False

questions.question: Agnostic solution logic is logic that is considered single-purpose because it is unique to one task. Select the correct answer.

responses.text: True
False

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false?

responses.text: Industry standards are usually produced by standards organizations.
Industry standards are usually created by standards committees so that they do not favor any one vendor or organization.
The use of industry standards alone automatically results in fully standardized service-oriented solutions.
XML is an example of an industry standard.

questions.question: You can create __________ or __________ service inventories.

responses.text: process-specific, process-wide
domain, enterprise
domain, process-specific
enterprise, process-specific

questions.question: __________ and __________ are used to classify and organize services within a service inventory.

responses.text: service compositions, service-oriented solutions
service capabilities, service compositions
service models, service layers
service contracts, service capabilities

questions.question: The standardization of services within a service inventory supports the repeated __________ of services, thereby increasing their potential reuse.

responses.text: integration
composition
definition
expression

questions.question: Solution logic is classified as 'service-oriented'after:

responses.text: it has been built using Web services
it has been built using RPC technologies
it has been performance tested to a meaningful extent
service-orientation has been applied to a meaningful extent

questions.question: A __________ can be part of a/an __________ which can be assembled from __________ within a/an __________.

responses.text: component, object, enterprises, service
service inventory, service, enterprises, service composition
service, service composition, services, service inventory
service inventory, service, service compositions, enterprise

questions.question: Two common, yet opposing SOA delivery approaches are:

responses.text: bottom-up and upside-down
top-down and left-to-right
upside-down and left-to-right
none of the above

questions.question: When designing service-oriented architectures, it is important to take the strategic goal of Increased Vendor Diversity Options into account, because this goal:

responses.text: encourages you to commit to one vendor platform and stick with that platform, which fosters long-term flexibility
encourages you to retain the constant option of using proprietary vendor features and extensions so that they can be entrenched into your service-orientedarchitectures for long-term flexibility
encourages you to retain the constant option to extend or replace parts of your service-oriented architectures with different vendor technologies or products,which fosters long-term flexibility
encourages you to bridge disparity between vendor platforms by using modern transformation technologies for long-term flexibility

questions.question: Services can be referred to as __________ because of the enterprise-centric design considerations of service-orientation and SOA.

enterprise resources

responses.text: its scope does not overlap with any existing databases
service boundaries within the service inventory do not overlap with each other
each service within the service inventory is not used by more than one service composition
legacy systems within the service inventory boundary do not overlap with each other

tactical (short-term), unimportant (low priority)
unimportant (low priority), important (high priority)

questions.question: Below are four statements about business and technology alignment, as it pertains to service-oriented computing. Which of these statements is false?

responses.text: Business and technology alignment represents the extent to which an IT enterprise and its automated systems can mirror and evolve in alignment with thebusiness.
Service-oriented computing promotes the abstraction and accurate encapsulation and expression of business logic in services. This supports business andtechnology alignment.
The pursuit of business and technology alignment can be supported by the collaboration of business analysts and technology experts during analysis andmodeling phases.

In order for an IT enterprise to increase business and technology alignment, its business analysts must become more technical and assume the responsibilitiesof technology experts so that they can independently design quality business services that take both business and technology considerations into account.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a benefit of maintaining a vendor-neutral and business-driven context for a service-oriented architecture?

responses.text: Establish a technology architecture with a fixed scope and purpose that remains unchanged, regardless of how the business may need to change over time.
Avoid establishing a technology architecture that will need to be replaced in the near future when it no longer adequately fulfills business requirements.
Leverage new technological innovation in order to maximize the fulfillment of business requirements.
Establish a technology architecture that can stay in alignment with how the business may need to change over time.

responses.text: The design standardization of service contracts helps increase interoperability between services.
Design standardization can introduce organizational and cultural challenges because it requires that the design standards be regularly enforced.
The design standardization of service contracts helps avoid the need for transformation technologies.
Design standardization is not relevant to the design of service compositions. It is only relevant to the design of individual services.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false?

responses.text: The governance burden of services is not impacted by the SOA project delivery approach.
The bottom-up approach to SOA project delivery results in less up-front impact, but will usually increase the eventual governance burden of services.
Alternative approaches exist that provide a compromise between bottom-up and top-down SOA project delivery approaches.
Up-front analysis as part of a top-down SOA project delivery approach helps reduce the eventual governance burden of services.
